definitions.definition: Like a tree ; having a structure or appearance similar to that of a tree; branching .
Marked by insistence on totalizing principles , binarism and dualism (as opposed to the rhizome theory).
examples: Gilles Deleuze criticizes the Chomsky hierarchy of formal languages, which he considers a perfect example of arborescent dualistic theory.

main_definition: Like a tree ; having a structure or appearance similar to that of a tree; branching .
secondary_definitions: ( philosophy ) Marked by insistence on totalizing principles , binarism and dualism (as opposed to the rhizome theory).
